update.title: Transparent textures
update.reason: Closed in favor of PR targeting ign-common3

content.raw:
> not actually sure it is possible

I don't know, when it comes to COLLADA, if something can be set, there shall be an exporter out there setting it.

I'm ok ignoring the `texture` argument if we don't know of a use case.
content.html:
not actually sure it is possible

I don't know, when it comes to COLLADA, if something can be set, there shall be an exporter out there setting it.

I'm ok ignoring the texture argument if we don't know of a use case.

content.raw: Yup, @{557058:798a6cdf-d171-444d-b8af-5d088f9feb2d} , you could open a PR against `ign-common3` instead so we don't need to use `ign-common4`.
content.html: Yup, @Luca Della Vedova , you could open a PR against ign-common3 instead so we don't need to use ign-common4.

content.raw: I just noticed that the changes here actually do not break API / ABI so they are backwards compatible
content.html: I just noticed that the changes here actually do not break API / ABI so they are backwards compatible

content.raw:
The tag is a child of the material description so I believe there is no risk of it being applied to the wrong material so I find the information there quite redundant.

The only possible case in which it could be necessary to disambiguate is if there is more than one texture for a <profile\_COMMON> but I never encountered such a case before and not actually sure it is possible?
content.html:
The tag is a child of the material description so I believe there is no risk of it being applied to the wrong material so I find the information there quite redundant.

The only possible case in which it could be necessary to disambiguate is if there is more than one texture for a <profile_COMMON> but I never encountered such a case before and not actually sure it is possible?

content.raw:
This form of API was suggested in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/229](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/229/added-basic-support-for-alpha-textures-in/diff#chg-CMakeLists.txt), I kinda agree with it because most of the times you would want to set all three parameters to get some decent transparency behavior. Specifically, in the experiments I made two sided rendering should always be enabled and the alpha parameter is a sensible default that helps with shadow casting.

Basically if you only enable alpha you will have wrong shadows and non-visible faces behind the transparent objects, which I believe is not what any user would want. I’m, afraid that if we split into three setters the user might be tricked into only calling “EnableAlphaRendering” and left to wonder why there is so many glitches?

I’m open to having both the three setters and the user facing convenience function above, if you want symmetry between getters and setters.
content.html:
This form of API was suggested in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/229, I kinda agree with it because most of the times you would want to set all three parameters to get some decent transparency behavior. Specifically, in the experiments I made two sided rendering should always be enabled and the alpha parameter is a sensible default that helps with shadow casting.

Basically if you only enable alpha you will have wrong shadows and non-visible faces behind the transparent objects, which I believe is not what any user would want. I’m, afraid that if we split into three setters the user might be tricked into only calling “EnableAlphaRendering” and left to wonder why there is so many glitches?

I’m open to having both the three setters and the user facing convenience function above, if you want symmetry between getters and setters.

content.raw:
Just checking if we can ignore the `texture` attribute, in your example:

```
            <transparent opaque="A_ONE">
              <texture texture="cage_png-sampler"/>
            </transparent>
```
content.html:
Just checking if we can ignore the texture attribute, in your example:

            <transparent opaque="A_ONE">
              <texture texture="cage_png-sampler"/>
            </transparent>

content.raw: There are 3 separate getters, how about also splitting the setter into 3?
content.html: There are 3 separate getters, how about also splitting the setter into 3?
